```{r read.csv}
library(readr)
example_track_ <- read_csv("Book2.csv")
sapply(example_track_, class)
View(example_track_)
```
```{r explore & Summary statistics}
library(tidyr)
library(rstatix)
paired_data <- example_track_[,c(1,4,11,16)] %>% na.omit("core affect_1")
View(paired_data)
# transform data into long data 
longformat_paired_data <- paired_data %>% gather(key = "timeline", value = "mood"  ,"core affect_1", "core affect_2", "core affect_3")
View(longformat_paired_data)
#mean 
library(dplyr)
group_by(longformat_paired_data, timeline) %>%
  summarise(
    count = n(),
    mean = mean(mood, na.rm = TRUE),
    sd = sd(mood, na.rm = TRUE)
  )
#boxplot
library(ggplot2)
library(ggpubr)
ggboxplot(longformat_paired_data, x = "timeline", y = "mood", 
          color = "timeline", palette = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800", "#FC4E07"),
          order = c("core affect_1", "core affect_2", "core affect_3"),
          ylab = "Mood", xlab = "Timeline")
### Mean plots
# Plot weight by group
# Add error bars: mean_se
# (other values include: mean_sd, mean_ci, median_iqr, ....)
#line plot
library("ggpubr")
me <- ggline(longformat_paired_data, x = "timeline", y = "mood", 
       add = c("mean_se", "jitter"), 
       order = c("core affect_1", "core affect_2", "core affect_3"),
       ylab = "Mood", xlab = "Timeline")
me
```
```{r one-way repeated Anova}
library(dplyr)
library(modeldata)
str(longformat_paired_data)
# one-way repeated Anova
res.aov <- anova_test(data = longformat_paired_data, dv = mood, wid = Date, within = timeline)
get_anova_table(res.aov)
# pairwise comparisons
pwc <- longformat_paired_data %>%
  pairwise_t_test(
    mood ~ timeline, paired = TRUE,
    p.adjust.method = "bonferroni"
    )
pwc
#Effect Size  
longformat_paired_data %>% cohens_d(mood ~ timeline, paired = TRUE)
# Visualization: box plots with p-values
pwc <- pwc %>% add_xy_position(x = "timeline")
bxp + 
  stat_pvalue_manual(pwc) +
  labs(
    subtitle = get_test_label(res.aov, detailed = TRUE),
    caption = get_pwc_label(pwc)
    )
```
```{r plot logitudinal data using "plot_trajectories"}
library(lcsm)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
library(stringr)
#prepare data 
paired_data_2 <- example_track_[,c(1,4,11,16)] %>% na.omit("core affect_1")
View(paired_data_2)
#create vector of variable name "Timeline"
x_var_list <- c("core affect_1", "core affect_2","core affect_3")
#create long data set 
data_long <- paired_data_2 %>% select("Date", all_of(x_var_list)) %>% 
#pivot data long
pivot_longer(cols = all_of(x_var_list), names_to = "time", values_to = "Mood") %>% mutate(
  time = str_extract(time, "\\d+"),
time = factor(as.numeric(time))
)
View(data_long)
# Create longitudinal plot for vector x
plot_trajectories(data = paired_data_2,
                  id_var = "Date", 
                  var_list = x_var_list,
                  xlab = "Timeline", ylab = "Mood",
                  connect_missing = FALSE, 
                  title_n = FALSE)
```
```{r plot logitudinal data using "ggplot2"}
View(Book2)
#read in data set
moodlevel <- example_track_[,c(1,4,11,16)] %>% na.omit("core affect_1")
moodlevel
longformat_moodlevel <- moodlevel %>% gather(key = "timeline", value = "mood"  ,"core affect_1", "core affect_2", "core affect_3")
View(longformat_moodlevel)
## change Date to factor variables
library(forcats)
longformat_moodlevel$"Date" <-  as_factor(longformat_moodlevel$"Date")
longformat_moodlevel 
str(longformat_moodlevel)  
# line plot ggplot2
p_line <- ggplot(data=longformat_moodlevel, aes(x=timeline, y=mood, group=Date))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()
p_line
# add color and title 
p_color<- p_line +
geom_line(aes(color=Date))+
  geom_point(aes(color=Date))+
 ggtitle("Mood change by timeline")
p_color
# add a line for mean 
p_mean <- ggplot(data=longformat_moodlevel, aes(x=timeline, y=mood, group=Date))+
geom_line(linetype="dashed",color = "grey")+
  stat_summary(aes(y = mood,group=1), fun.y=mean, colour="red",size=1.2,geom="line",group=1)+
 ggtitle("Mood change by timeline")
p_mean
```
